author: Special Correspondent
text:
Accommodating some senior Bihar leaders who lost the Assembly elections last year, the ruling Janata Dal(United) on Sunday constituted a State Executive comprising 61 members.

In all likelihood, the party may choose ‘Banyan tree’ as its new symbol, abandoning the current ‘Arrow’, which was perceived as “confusing” for voters, contributing to the party’s loss in the polls, according to party sources.

The State Executive comprises 14 general secretaries, 11 vice-presidents, one treasurer and seven party spokespersons.

Former Speaker Uday Narayan Chaudhury and former ministers P K Shahi, Damodar Raut and Manoj Kushwaha, all of whom had lost the Assembly elections, have been included in list of party vice-presidents.
title: ‘Banyan tree’ may be new JD(U) symbol
